page.title: 10HOUSING
page.content: The 5th Duke of Portland was responsible for the building of forty or fifty lodges to cover all the roads into Welbeck Abbey. These lodges are large, ornate, stone houses built in the Neo-Tudor style. They provide accommodation for Welbeck Estates workers. High Holbeck was also built to provide housing for the employees of the Welbeck Estates Company. The large semi-detached houses are built in a square around a central green and recreation area. Much of the rest of the housing in this area consists of stone cottages and farms. Some have an interesting mixture of stone and brickwork.
